column4: Whenever trying to start Ubuntu linux, I get a "Fatal Server Error: Caught Signal 4" It then reverts to a DOS-like interface (I'm currently on WinXP, I just installed ubuntu on top of it)
no no no - i meant i installed it with winxp
i partitioned and everything and installed ubuntu, so i now have both
but ubuntu keeps giving me some error with "X" every time it starts
at this moment i'm on winxp
i've searched a bit on google with this, and found other people with this problem, but no solution found yet
you will probably find some diagnostic information in /var/log/Xorg.0.log
reboot to recovery mode or install a Windows ext2 driver to read the log.
either that or a filesystem driver for Windows.
in recovery mode, you could try tweaking X settings with 'dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg'
for an ext2 driver for Windows, you'd have to search the web or ask the channel again.
you could try installing ati drivers by following the wiki
